responsibilities: Would you like to join a growing and evolving IT department in a role where you will cover our production, finance and retail?, , In this job, you will be key in ensuring that our business-critical SAP platform is solid and secure. And you will be the go-to specialist within your field as we take security to the next level., , Be our specialist on SAP authorisation, , Within Global IT, you will join our international Cybersecurity & Compliance team which has recently gone through an exciting period of growth. Today, we are 19 colleagues responsible for the cyber security of ECCO globally, covering everything from the ECCO shoe production to retail and administration., , Working closely with colleagues based in Denmark, Poland, and Indonesia, you will be fronting the area of SAP authorisation. Almost half of our larger IT department is somehow involved in the platform. Thus, you will be the go-to-person with special knowledge of authorisations, segregation of duty as well as the purpose and implications of identity and access management, , Specifically, you will participate in projects to improve the above-mentioned areas. One such project is our S4Hana work, but you will also perform authorisations and ensure that the documentation on our authorisation processes is correct. Moreover, you will:, , â¢	Participate in IAM, IGA, PAM, â¢	Work with local authorisation approvers to identify and solve business problems, â¢	Participate in internal and external audits, understand risk and SOD conflicts and ensure top-level audit results, â¢	Develop the road map for the authorisation strategy in ECCO, â¢	Be the sounding board to business process managers and our IT organisation regarding design and implementation of changes to the authorisation process
experienceRequirements: As a person, you are ready to share your knowledge and work across different departments and cultures. You also need good communication skills combined with a knack for diplomacy when it comes to the authorization process., Finally, we imagine that you:, , â¢	May have a background in IT, finance or production, where you have worked in either an international company or as a consultant, â¢	Have a few years of experience with SAP authorisations, â¢	Have some knowledge on Identity and Access Management and Governance, â¢	Have experience with S4Hana, â¢	Are fluent in English, , You will be based in Poland, where you will find the majority of your stakeholders.

responsibilities: Masterplanning design, , Support the implementation of a consistent roadmap and common reporting which provides visibility into main Programs / Projects deliveries for Business- and Functional leaders, operational Project Teams as well as Senior Management, Ensure in co-ordination with Masterplanning Manager that existing roadmapping capabilities- and stakeholders are leveraged, built out and enriched to a broader scope across AXA XL, Very closely work with Masterplanning Manager, other Project Portfolio Management stakeholders as well as technical teams to ensure an efficient development and maintenance of the masterplanning capability and its visualization, Enable main Programs / Projects at AXA XL to dynamically visualize the implementation of the various initiatives over time through an integrated masterplanning tool and provide insights on planned- vs actual delivery of the respective milestones, Masterplanning implementation, , Enforce that initiatives are proactively tracked by working with Program- / Project Managers, Initiative Owners as well as PMO Large Programs support (as applicable) to build and update roadmaps as needed, tracking progress towards milestones, Ensure that appropriate governance is in place and enforced so that timeliness and quality of updates lead to permanently up to date and complete roadmaps. Communicate within main Programs / Projects rationale for masterplanning requirements and which inputs are necessary by when to make sure the roadmaps provide relevant insights, Align with Project Portfolio Management stakeholders (including Large Program Support) that masterplanning activities are seamlessly embedded in wider governance framework and specifically resourcing impacts are proactively identified (e.g. Ops & Tech and Business), Make sure that Business- and Functional leaders as well as operational Project Teams use the masterplanning to drive insights and implementation related decision making. At times you may be asked to adjust your hours to support/collaborate across global time zones.
